Let me start by saying that beautiful websites come in all sizes and page weights.  I love big websites packed with images. I love high-resolution video. I love sprawling Javascript experiments or well-designed web apps.

links.title: How does Google Authenticator work? (Part 1)
links.description:
When you‚Äôre accessing services over the WEB ‚Äì let‚Äôs pick GMail as an example ‚Äì couple of things have to happen upfront:
 The server you‚Äôre connecting to (GMail in our example) has to get to know who you are. Only after getting to know who you are it‚Äôs able to decide what resources you are allowed to access (e.g. your own email inbox, your Calendar, Drive etc.).  Step 1 above is called authentication.

links.title: Pragma statements supported by SQLite
links.description:
The PRAGMA statement is an SQL extension specific to SQLite and used to 
modify the operation of the SQLite library or to query the SQLite library for 
internal (non-table) data. The PRAGMA statement is issued using the same
interface as other SQLite commands (e.g. SELECT, INSERT) but is
different in the following important respects:
